title: Soji appam
instructions: Required oil (Preferably peanut oil) for frying
Prepare a checklist. Keep the necessary items near the cooking area
Prepare a checklist. Keep the necessary items near the cooking area

To make the wrap:
Combine semolina, flour, turmeric and salt in a bowl. Pour 1 tablespoon of hot oil and knead well by hand.
Add water little by little and gently knead for 10 minutes. Make a soft dough. Apply oil on top and cover and rest for 30 minutes.

To make the filling:
Roast the semolina in a sauce pan over medium heat until golden brown.
Bring ¬º cup water to a boil in a sauce pan over medium heat. Jaggery is 100% pure here, no need to distill it to add jaggery. Let it boil. Add Grated coconut, roasted semolina, cardamom powder and salt. Stir together. Turn off the stove. Let cool. Then make small balls.

Making soji appam: Pinch 3tbsp dough; grease your palm. Keep the dough in the palm, and make lemon size balls
Convert the ball into a basket like structure, keep the filling in the center, bring the edges together, and close (just as you would make poli or kachori)

Place this on a greased parchment paper or palm and flatten it by gently patting it with your fingers (picture).
Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan over medium heat. Fry the soji appam one by one. Place the spoon over the edge and rotate it slowly. Let both sides become golden brown. Take it out. drain the oil. Place on a paper towel to absorb excess oil on the surface
Then transfer to another plate. A delicious soji appam is ready. Taste and serve. Enjoy, have a good celebration with friends and family

instructions: ml or 1 Can Coconut Milk or 250 ml
A few Coriander and Mint leaves
In a rice cooker bowl: Wash the rice 3-4 times until water is clear. Drain all the water from the rice.
Make a mixture of coconut milk and 6 cups of water
Add coconut milk and water mixture to the rice
Add the ingredients from the spices section and mix well
Cover and let the ingredients rest for 1 hour.. longer the better.
When ready to cook. Activate the rice cooker
When the rice is cooked, fluff up the rice and garnish with some coriander and mint leaves
Fragrant Rice is now ready to served with the choice of your favorite curries üòä

instructions: Heat oil in a pan,add mustard seed,urad dhall & chana dhall.Once mustard seeds started splaterring add onion,green chilli,ginger & curry leaves.
Once onion turns transparent add carrot,peas,tomato,salt & saute it for 5minutes.
Then add water,for 1cup of broken wheat add 2cups of water.
Once water starts boiling add broken wheat & mix it. Cover the pan & keep the flame on medium low.
Wait till the broken wheat cooked & water is absorbed. Once cooked turn off the stove.
Our broken wheat upma or dalia upma is ready to serve with coconut chutney or pickle :-)

instructions: as required  Oil or ghee to fry dosas
Soak Moong Dal over night and grind in to a thick batter adding chillies, cumin seeds and ginger.
You may add water and make like dosa batter. Add salt.
In a pan add one teaspoon of oil and add mustard and cumin seeds after spluttering add water and salt. When bubbling water add Semolina and cook. After two minutes of cooking switch off the flame.
Place flat non- stick tawa on stove and take a ladle of batter and spread in circular form as thin as possible.
Add stuffing inside with all above-mentioned ingredients and also upma
Fry with ghee until golden in colour

title: Soybeans Upma
ingredients:
Premium






Top Cooksnapped Recipes



Premium Meal Plans



Top Viewed Recipes
instructions: tbsp olive oil or coconut oil

Soak 1/2 cup soy beans overnight. 
Drain the water and pressure cook it with salt and little water.
Grind grated coconut, 1spoon coriander seeds, dried red chili and garlic in a blender with water as needed.
Heat pan with oil and temper with rai,curry leaves, haldi and hing.
Add one chopped onion and fry till transparent. Now add peanuts and saut√© for a few seconds
Add ground paste and add cooked soybeans

Can add little water to mix well. 
Cook for 6 to 8 min or until water evaporates and Masala starts browning.
Enjoy this healthy and protein packed soybeans Upma in breakfast or evening snacks.
